definition: to speak/to explain/to negotiate/to emphasise/to be particular about/as far as sth is concerned/speech/lecture
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods

sentences.english: The professor spoke for a long time, but I'm afraid his meaning did not come across.
sentences.chinese: 那教授講了半天，但我想他沒把意思講明白。

sentences.english: He spoke for a long time but his meaning did not come across.
sentences.chinese: 他說了很久，但是沒有把他的意思講明白。

sentences.english: Please give me your reasons for refusing.
sentences.chinese: 請向我講明你拒絕的理由。

sentences.english: She’s telling him that he can’t go with her to see his father.
sentences.chinese: 她跟他講明，不能帶他去見他父親。

sentences.english: These things speak, and exhort, and rebuke with all authority.
sentences.chinese: 這些事你要講明，勸戒人，用各等權柄責備人。

sentences.english: First I ask Julie to tell me some things she wants from me during this month.
sentences.chinese: 首先，我讓朱莉講明這個月她想讓我做的事情。

sentences.english: The boss of the company, whose name was Mr Little, told the story about Ms King and then said.
sentences.chinese: 公司的老闆利特爾先生講明瞭金女士的情況，然後說。

sentences.english: Paul told her, I must tell xiao ya know, including work and feelings.
sentences.chinese: 保羅告訴她，自己要跟小雅講明白，包括工作和感情。

sentences.english: The lecturer tried to drum in his viewpoint, but the students were not listening.
sentences.chinese: 演講者設法講明他的觀點，但學生們卻充耳不聞。
